bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Joseph H. White to Frederick F. Russell, [received] July 29, 1925 [Enclosed in C031003]

div1.p: White wants Henry Rose Carter to review two cases that present some symptoms of yellow fever, but present other symptoms that make him doubt that diagnosis.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph H. White to Frederick F. Russell, [received] July 29, 1925 [Enclosed in C0310003]
div1.p:
I should like Dr. Carter to review the two cases herein
described*. They present certainly some symptoms of Yellow Fever
but on the other hand they present other things that don't jibe
with anything I know unless it might be (in the native case) Weil's
Disease.

I am very doubtful about them but have nevertheless insti-
tuted measures, and ordered investigation of Throizina, as well as
renewing work in S. Luiz.

closer.add:
* Papers sent you under date of
July 9 - from Smith's
report for May.
